info.description: REST interface for the Insights Platform Host Inventory application.
info.title: Insights Host Inventory REST Interface

get.summary: Read the entire list of hosts
get.description:
Read the entire list of all hosts available to the account.

Required permissions: inventory:hosts:read

delete.summary: Delete the entire list of hosts filtered by the given parameters
delete.description:
Delete the entire list of hosts filtered by the given parameters.

Required permissions: inventory:hosts:write

202.description: Request for deletion of filtered hosts has been accepted.

delete.summary: Delete all hosts on the account
delete.description:
Delete all hosts on the account. The request must include "confirm_delete_all=true".

Required permissions: inventory:hosts:write

202.description: Request for deleting all hosts has been accepted.

post.summary: Update staleness timestamps for a host matching the provided facts
post.description:
Finds a host and updates its staleness timestamps. It uses the supplied canonical facts to determine which host to update. By default, the staleness timestamp is set to 1 hour from when the request is received; however, this can be overridden by supplying the interval.

Required permissions: inventory:hosts:write

Facts.title: Host facts
Facts.description: A set of string facts about a host.

FactSet.title: Host facts under a namespace
FactSet.description: A set of string facts belonging to a single namespace.

namespace.description: A namespace the facts belong to.

InsightsId.description: An ID defined in /etc/insights-client/machine-id. This field is considered a canonical fact.

SubscriptionManagerId.description: A Red Hat Subcription Manager ID of a RHEL host.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

SatelliteId.description: A Red Hat Satellite ID of a RHEL host.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

BiosUuid.description: A UUID of the host machine BIOS.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

IpAddresses.description: Host’s network IP addresses.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

Fqdn.description: A host’s Fully Qualified Domain Name.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

MacAddresses.description: Host’s network interfaces MAC addresses.  This field is considered to be a canonical fact.

ProviderId.description: Host’s reference in the external source e.g. Alibaba, AWS EC2, Azure, GCP, IBM etc. This field is one of the canonical facts and does not work without provider_type.

ProviderType.description: Type of external source e.g. Alibaba, AWS EC2, Azure, GCP, IBM, etc. This field is one of the canonical facts and does not workout provider_id.

AccountNumber.description: A Red Hat Account number that owns the host.

OrgId.description: The Org ID of the tenant that owns the host.
